Package de.gmxhome.conrad.jpos.jpos_base

Class JnaSerial

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.gmxhome.conrad.jpos.jpos_base.JnaSerial
  • public class JnaSerial
extends java.lang.Object
    Class for serial communication via native OS calls using JNA. Currently only implemented for Windows

    • Constructor Detail

      • JnaSerial

        public JnaSerial()
          throws jpos.JposException
        Constructor. Creates communication adapter.
        Throws:
        jpos.JposException - If the operating system is not supported by JnaSerial.

    • Method Detail

      • write

        public void write​(byte[] buffer)
           throws jpos.JposException
        Write the given byte buffer to the com port.
        Parameters:
        buffer - Buffer to be written
        Throws:
        jpos.JposException - If the port has not been opened or in case of an IO error.

      • available

        public int available()
              throws jpos.JposException
        Returns the number of received bytes that can be read without blocking.
        Returns:
        Number of bytes just in device input buffer.
        Throws:
        jpos.JposException - In case of an IO error

      • read

        public byte[] read​(int count,
                   int timeout)
            throws jpos.JposException
        Reads data from a communication port. If no data are available, read blocks until data are available or the specified timeout has been reached.
        Parameters:
        count - Maximum number of bytes to be read.
        timeout - Maximum time to wait for data in milliseconds.
        Returns:
        byte array holding all available data bytes
        Throws:
        jpos.JposException - In case of an IO error.

      • flush

        public void flush()
           throws jpos.JposException
        Flushed input and output buffers.
        Throws:
        jpos.JposException - In case of an IO error.

      • open

        public void open​(java.lang.String port)
          throws jpos.JposException
        Opens a port for serial IO.
        Parameters:
        port - Port. e.g. COM2
        Throws:
        jpos.JposException - If the port does not exist or in case of IO errors.

      • close

        public void close()
           throws jpos.JposException
        Close the communication port.
        Throws:
        jpos.JposException - In case of IO error.

      • setParameters

        public void setParameters​(int baudrate,
                          int databits,
                          int stopbits,
                          int parity)
                   throws jpos.JposException
        Set communication parameters. These are:
        Parameters:
        baudrate - Baudrate: 1200, 4800, 9600, 19200, 38400, 57600, 115200, 128000 or 256000.
        databits - Bits per date unit: 7 or 8.
        stopbits - Number of stop bits to be used, 1 or 2.
        parity - Parity, represented by 0 (no), 1 (odd), 2 (even), 3 (mark) or 4 (space).
        Throws:
        jpos.JposException - If an IO error occurs of if a parameter is invalid.

      • exits

        public boolean exits​(java.lang.String port)
        Checks whether a port still exists. In case of serial communication via Bluetooth or USB, ports can go lost.
        Parameters:
        port - Port to be checked.
        Returns:
        true if the port still exists, false otherwise-
